mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Learns through Mr. Page with great pleasure that he will accept secretaryship of New Orleans and encloses commission; advises against going there before last of October because of climate; mentions salary and suggests that he get in touch with the former secretary, Mr. Graham, now in Richmond.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1807 August 17, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to Bolling Robinson, n.p.
